{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3349951,"name":"tindleroot","username":"tindleroot","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/9fc29f/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-02T06:11:51.190Z","cooked":"

Hello! My team is encountering an issue when running holonomic PathPlanner on-the-fly paths. Our auto routine calls pathFindToPoseFlipped() (along with Choreo-generated fixed paths), and the first dynamic path always works. The second dynamic path only works sometimes - other times it uses the same path as the first one, ultimately ending up at the same endpoint as the first path but with the intended rotation.

Looking at the PathPlanner source, I suspect the ADStar code is having some sort of error/exception which is not allowing it to update the path when the second pathFind command is scheduled. Any ideas on how to debug the issue would be much appreciated, or a workaround we can look into. I’m also happy to hear any recommendations on PathPlannerLib best practices that we ought to adopt to reduce risk of error, since we are new to PathPlanner. Thanks!

Code: VikingRobot2024/src/main/java/frc/robot/Autonomous.java at main · FRC-2928/VikingRobot2024 · GitHub
Refer to the [comp] Five Note routine, all the relevant code should be in Autonomous and Drivetrain classes.

Why don’t you use the PathPlanner GUI to create an autonomous?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-04-02T06:35:12.717Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":126,"readers_count":125,"score":50.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":461007,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-issue-2nd-pathfindtopose-is-using-the-the-same-path-as-1st-time","display_username":"Ezra","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62434,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5990 | Programmer, Electronics Lead, and Driver"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-issue-2nd-pathfindtopose-is-using-the-the-same-path-as-1st-time/461007/2","custom_user_title":"5990 | Programmer, Electronics Lead, and Driver","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3349966,"name":"tindleroot","username":"tindleroot","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/9fc29f/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-02T06:56:31.992Z","cooked":"

We were using ChoreoLib to run the paths at our previous competitions and only started using PathPlanner to try and leverage the pathfinding, since Choreo only provides precomputed pathing capability. Moving to PathPlanner GUI for auto building is probably a good idea, though we haven’t gotten around to it yet.

“Why don’t your completely switch over to a different tool two days before competition?”

Thanks for your input. We chose Choreo for Sleipnir and we’re not going to change it this season given the time we have. The solution to a problem is not always reworking your codebase.

The issue is that we are getting the correct target pose from the Choreo trajectories, but as @tindleroot mentioned, PathPlannerLib seems to try and repeat its previous trajectory.

An important detail to note is that the issue only occurs when running the same autonomous without restarting robot code in-between, so while this works on the real field, it’s frustrating to test.

The method names dynamic and dynamicThen are not descriptive, but I question what dynamic does. It’s quite a bit different from dynamicThen. It appears to load a Choreo trajectory, but it only creates a PathPlanner path to drive to the trajectory’s starting point. Is that what it’s supposed to do?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-04-02T17:33:50.540Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":91,"readers_count":90,"score":23.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":461007,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-issue-2nd-pathfindtopose-is-using-the-the-same-path-as-1st-time","display_username":"Andy Gasser","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-issue-2nd-pathfindtopose-is-using-the-the-same-path-as-1st-time/461007/5","custom_user_title":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3350564,"name":"tindleroot","username":"tindleroot","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/9fc29f/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-02T18:24:36.244Z","cooked":"

You are correct. We built our Choreo paths with this in mind - using PathPlanner to dynamically get to the start point of the provided Choreo trajectory, which we run after shooting a note from that spot.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-04-02T18:24:36.244Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":87,"readers_count":86,"score":22.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":461007,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-issue-2nd-pathfindtopose-is-using-the-the-same-path-as-1st-time","display_username":"tindleroot","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":44380,"username":"gdefender","name":"Andy Gasser","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22920,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-issue-2nd-pathfindtopose-is-using-the-the-same-path-as-1st-time/461007/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3350584,"name":"Rahul Yarlagadda","username":"Knufire","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/knufire/{size}/67820_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-02T18:38:02.746Z","cooked":"

I think you may be overcomplicating this a bit. We have been using PathplannerLib to follow Choreo-generated paths all season without any sort of explicit replanning between path segments to ensure that we are at the start point of the next segment. When we do end a previous segment slightly off from the expected pose, Pathplanner is doing a relatively good job at correcting the error at the start of the next segment. These are generally pretty small deviations of less than 1m though.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-04-02T18:38:29.338Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":80,"readers_count":79,"score":66.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":461007,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-issue-2nd-pathfindtopose-is-using-the-the-same-path-as-1st-time","display_username":"Rahul Yarlagadda","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":22920,"username":"tindleroot","name":"tindleroot","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/9fc29f/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12760,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7457 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-issue-2nd-pathfindtopose-is-using-the-the-same-path-as-1st-time/461007/7","custom_user_title":"7457 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3350607,"name":"tindleroot","username":"tindleroot","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/9fc29f/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-02T18:55:32.843Z","cooked":"

This is great intel! We originally added the dynamic pathing since our note intake command uses a camera to seek the nearby note, thus breaking the path continuity. However, in practice I’d say it rarely if ever moves more than 1 foot so perhaps PathPlanner can adjust for the error. We talked about switching to static paths, we’ll make sure to try this on the practice field before DCMP.

Thanks!
